name: Dwarf
shortDesc: Short and stout, bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners and workers of stone and metal. Dwarves who take up the adventuring life may be motivated by a desire for treasure; others are driven by inspiration or command of a deity or seek to climb their clan’s hierarchy. They are slow to trust elves, halflings and humans.

traits.commonAlign: Most dwarves are lawful and tend toward good

subraces.name: Hill Dwarf
subraces.summary: Keen senses, deep intuition and remarkable resilience

subraces.name: Mountain Dwarf
subraces.summary: Accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain

name: Elf
shortDesc: Slender and graceful, unearthly grace and fine features.  With a timeless perspective, more often amused than excited and more likely to be curious than greedy.

traits.commonAlign: Elves lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They are more often good then not, with the exception of the Drow. Drow are usually evil and vicious.

subraces.name: High Elf
subraces.summary: Keen mind and a mastery of basic magic

subraces.name: Wood Elf
subraces.summary: Keen senses and intuition, swift feet carry you quickly and stealthily through native woods.

subraces.name: Dark Elf (Drow)
subraces.summary: Rare and does not exist in all worlds.

name: Halfling
shortDesc: Small and practical, kind and Curious they are adebt at fitting into a community of humans, dwarves or elves.

subraces.name: Lightfoot
subraces.summary: You can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover.

subraces.name: Stout
subraces.summary: Hardier than average and have resistance to poison. Stronghearted.

name: Human
shortDesc: They are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Widely varying tastes, morals, and customs in many different lands where they have settled. They are also more physically diverse than other common races.

traits.commonAlign: Humans tend towards no particular alignment.

subraces.name: Calishite
subraces.summary: Shorter and slighter in build than most other humans, they have dusky brown skin, hair, and eyes.

subraces.name: Chondathan
subraces.summary: Slender, tawny-skinned folk with brown hair that ranges from almost blonde to almost black. Most are tall and have green or brown eyes.

subraces.name: Damaran
subraces.summary: Moderate of height and build with skin hues ranging from tawny to fair. Their hair is usually brown or black, and their eye color varies widely, though brown is most common.

subraces.name: Illuskan
subraces.summary: Tall, fair-skinned folk with blue or steely grey eyes. Most have raven-black hair.

subraces.name: Mulan
subraces.summary: Generally tall, slim, and amber-skinned with eyes of hazel or brown. Their hair ranges from black to dark brown, but nobles and many others shave off all their hair.

subraces.name: Rashemi
subraces.summary: Tend to be short, stout, and muscular. They usually have dusky skin, dark eyes, and thick black hair.

subraces.name: Shou
subraces.summary: Yellowish-brown in hue with black hair and dark eyes.

subraces.name: Tethyrian
subraces.summary: Medium build and height with dusky skin that tends to grow fairer the farther north they live. Theis hair and eye color varies widely, but brown hair and blue eyes are the most common.

subraces.name: Turami
subraces.summary: Generally tall and muscular with dark mahogany skin, curly black hair, and dark eyes.

name: Dragonborn
shortDesc:
The clan is more important that life itself. They owe their devotion and respect to their clan above all else, even the gods. Continuous drive for self-improvement reflects the self-sufficiency of the race as a whole. They recognize that help is sometimes needed in difficult situations.

 The blood of a particular type of dragon runs very strong through dragonborn clans. They often boast scales that more closely match those of their dragon ancestry: bright red, green, blue, or white, lustrous black, or gleaming metallic gold, silver, brass, copper, or bronze.

traits.commonAlign: Dragon born tend to extremes and make a concious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil. Most dragonborn are good.

subraces.name: Black
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Acid

subraces.name: Blue
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Lightening

subraces.name: Brass
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Fire

subraces.name: Bronze
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Lightening

subraces.name: Copper
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Acid

subraces.name: Gold
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Fire

subraces.name: Green
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Poison

subraces.name: Red
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Fire

subraces.name: Silver
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Cold

subraces.name: White
subraces.summary: Damage Type: Cold

name: Gnome
shortDesc: A gnome’s energy and enthusiasm for living shines through every inch of his or her tiny body. Gnomes speak as if they can’t get the thoughts out of their heads fast enough.

traits.commonAlign: Gnomes are mostly good. Those who lean towards lawful are sages, engineers, scholars, or investigators. Those who lean towards chaos are tricksters, wanderers, minstrels, or fanciful jewelers.

subraces.name: Forest Gnome
subraces.summary: Rare and secretive, you have a natural knack for illusion and inherent quickness and stealth.

subraces.name: Rock Gnome
subraces.summary: Most common, you have a natural inventiveness and hardiness.

name: Half-Elf
shortDesc: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.

traits.abilScore: +2 Charisma and +1 to two other abilities of your choice
traits.commonAlign: Because half-elves value both personal freedom and creative expression, they tend to be more chaotic.

name: Half-orc
shortDesc: Some half-orcs rise to become proud chiefs of orc tribes, their human blood giving them an edge over their full-blooded orc rivals. Some venture into the world to prove their worth among humans and other more civilized races. Many of these become adventurers, achieving greatness for their mighty deeds and notoriety for their barbaric customs and savage fury.

traits.commonAlign: Half-orcs inherit a tendency towards chaos and are not strongly inclined towards good.

name: Tiefling
shortDesc: Tieflings are derived from human bloodlines. Their infernal heritage has left a clear imprint on their appearance. Lacking a homeland, tieflings have to make their own way in the world and have to be strong to survive. They are not quick to trust anyone who claims to be a friend, but when a tiefling’s companions demonstrate that they trust him or her, the tiefling learns to extend the same trust to them. Once a tiefling gives someone loyalty, they are a firm friend or ally for life.
